Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield were breaking down the biggest stories from the Oscars - and there was one that will be talked about for a long time. 
"It's just horrible for everybody involved," Holly said as both stars admitted they felt sorry for all the parties on stage. Holly and Phil discuss the Oscars gaffe (Photo: ITV) The shocking scenes at the end of the ceremony (Photo: Getty) 
"I feel incredibly embarrassed for La La Land," Phillip added. "And Moonlight don't get their moment." Read More 
He also defended presenter Warren Beatty for the mishap, pointing out that it appears he knew something wasn't right when he opened the envelope. They felt sorry for everyone involved (Photo: ITV) Phil suggested Warren Beatty could tell something wasn't right (Photo: ITV) 
A statement from PricewaterhouseCoopers confirmed there had been an error with the wrong envelope handed to Best Picture presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, which led them to mistakenly crown La La Land the winner. 
In jaw-dropping scenes, the cast and crew of La La Land were half way through an acceptance speech on stage when the mistake was realised, and they had to hand over their Oscars to Moonlight in front of a TV audience of millions. 
In a statement , PWC said: "We sincerely apologize to Moonlight, La La Land, Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway, and Oscar viewers for the error that was made during the award announcement for best picture." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
